title: Erdős #644: Covering Families of Sets
description: Let f(k,r) be the minimum size of a covering set for k-uniform families where every r sets share a common pair. Known: f(k,3)=2k, f(k,4)=⌊3k/2⌋, f(k,5)=⌊5k/4⌋, f(k,6)=k. Is f(k,7)=(3/4+o(1))k?

overview.historicalContext: Erdős, Fon-Der-Flaass, Kostochka, and Tuza (1992) studied the function f(k,r): the minimum covering set size for k-uniform set families with the r-wise pair intersection property. They determined exact values for r = 3, 4, 5, 6, showing a decreasing sequence of coefficients.
overview.problemStatement: Let f(k,r) be minimal such that if A₁, A₂, ... is a family of k-sets where every r sets share a common pair {x,y} intersecting all of them, then some set of size f(k,r) intersects all Aᵢ. Q1: Is f(k,7) = (3/4 + o(1))k? Q2: For all r ≥ 3, does f(k,r) = (c_r + o(1))k for some constant c_r?
overview.proofStrategy: We formalize the r-wise pair intersection property, the covering function f(k,r), known exact values from EFKT92, monotonicity properties, extremal constructions, sunflower connections, and the two main open questions about asymptotic behavior.

sections.title: Monotonicity Properties
sections.summary: f(k,r) behavior in k and r

conclusion.summary: This formalization captures Erdős Problem #644 on covering families of sets. The function f(k,r) measures the minimum covering set size for k-uniform families with the r-wise pair property. Exact values are known for r = 3, 4, 5, 6, showing a pattern of decreasing coefficients.
conclusion.implications: Resolution would reveal whether the coefficient sequence has a limiting structure and what governs the asymptotic behavior of f(k,r) as r increases.
openQuestions: Does f(k,r) = (c_r + o(1))k for all r ≥ 3?
What is the limit of c_r as r → ∞?
